alert.note: Alert for Baker; Northern Columbia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Baker, northeastern Columbia, southeastern Echols, southeastern Ware, southeastern Clinch and central Charlton Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 844 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fargo to near Belmont. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fargo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Georgia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for northern and northeastern Florida.
